title: Labour: cost of living squeeze continues despite lower inflation - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: us producer prices unchanged in august .
oecd proposes new rules to rein in corporate tax avoidance .
labour : working people still feeling the squeeze despite lower inflation .
german investor morale hits two-year low .
scottish house prices hit new record highs .

documents.title: european markets edge lower
text: nervousness was evident among investors once more , writes nick fletcher , ahead of this week 's scottish referendum and the latest decisions from the us federal reserve on wednesday .

there were other reasons to be cautious , with worries about the effect of sanctions on russia over its actions in ukraine ( one of the reasons for a dip in german confidence ) and a dip in inward investment in china raising concerns about its growth outlook .
but news that the people 's bank of china was increasing liquidity to its leading banks helped limit some of the damage .

so the final scores showed : the ftse 100 finished down 11.97 points at 6792.24 germany 's dax dipped 0.28 % to 9632.93 france 's cac closed 0.44 % lower at 4409.15 italy 's ftse mib slipped 0.3 % to 20,788.50 spain 's ibex ended 0.39 % down at 10,789.7 but reports that the fed may not be as hawkish in its comments tomorrow as some feared have helped push the dow jones industrial average 90 points or 0.53 % higher .
on that note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments and we 'll be back tomorrow .

more on the forthcoming polls on the scottish referendum from analyst mike smithson : mike smithson ( @ msmithsonpb ) tonight 's tns poll is about uk attitudes to the indyref , not a poll on indyref voting intentions .
what a pity .
mike smithson ( @ msmithsonpb ) tonight 's # indyref polls icm for scotsman - ( no timings yet ) survation for s daily mail - 10.30pm both are online .

documents.title: the pound and september : a torrid month for britain 's currency
text: looking for some afternoon reading ?
here 's larry elliott , reminding us that september has often been a bad month for sterling : april is the cruellest month , ts eliot once wrote.not for the pound , it is n't .
without question the month that holds the maximum danger for sterling is september .
what 's more , this week - the week in which scotland decides whether it wants to become an independent country - tends to be the scariest week of the scariest month .
consider the evidence .
there were five big sterling crises in the 20th century , and four of them came to the boil in september .
in the circumstances , it 's not hard to see why foreign exchange dealers will be at their desks early on friday morning to await news from edinburgh about the referendum vote .

the story starts in 1931 , two years after the wall street crash and six years after sir winston churchill had , with some misgivings , put britain back on the gold standard at its pre first world war rate .
this involved a revaluation of the pound , a move that made uk exports more expensive .
industry 's pain intensified when global trade started to contract in the early years of the great depression .
the labour government of james ramsay macdonald found that it could only balance the budget by imposing spending cuts that led to a split in the party and the formation of a coalition .
international investors were spooked by a mutiny of sailors at invergordon and capital flight was not staunched by an austerity budget .
sterling left the gold standard forever on 21 september 1931 .
for more drama , click here : the pound and september : a torrid month for britain 's currency

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: time to recap ( do scroll back through the blog for more details , charts and reaction ) inflation in the uk has fallen back to its joint-lowest level in five year .
falling fuel and food bills helped to lower the consumer prices index to just 1.5 % in august .
the fall was welcomed by government ministers including chancellor george osborne .
george osborne ( @ george osborne ) good news inflation has fallen again to just 1.5 % , below the 2 % target .
but people still feeling impact of the great recession so more to do but the labour party , and the tuc union , both warned that the cost of living squeeze continues to hurt households .
tuc general secretary frances o'grady says : with inflation well under control there is no case for raising interest rates any time soon .
it would dump higher mortgage costs on households still feeling a squeeze on their living standards and risk choking off economic recovery .
as the governor of the bank of england said last week , british workers have faced pay cuts deeper than at any time since the 1920s .
the priority now has to be wage rises to ensure a sustained economic recovery and a return to growing living standards . ''

the drop takes the pressure off the bank of england to raise interest rates , predicts samuel tombs of capital economics : inflation is still on a downward trend despite the economic recovery 's strength .
although the low inflation outlook is unlikely to prevent the mpc from raising interest rates entirely over the next couple of years , it should limit the speed at which they rise . ''
house prices have continued to climb , pushing average scottish prices to record highs..
the average uk home value has risen by 11.9 % in the last year .
and houses in london jumped by 19 % , meaning the average house in the capital now costs £ 514,000 .
elsewhere there 's no sign of rampant inflation in the us , with producer prices flat in august .
the oecd has proposed a clampdown on multinationals avoiding paying their fair share of tax .
the ukraine crisis has pushed german investor confidence down to a two-year low .

and it 's helped to sent the russian ruble down to its lowest ever point against the us dollar and on scotland an investor survey has found that thursday 's scottish independence vote has hit appetite for investing in the uk betfair is paying out to punters who bet that scotland will reject independence ( some customers , anyway ) while the boss of thomas cook has predicted that scots will still want a break from one of the worst climates in the world '' if they vote yes .

and with more polls due tonight , the markets remain tense ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) scottish referendum poll update : there will be a new tns-bmrb poll released this evening at 1700bst/1100cdt # indyref steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) so we have a second poll to expect survation at 10.30pm tns due at about 5pm ish # scotland
something to ponder ben white ( @ morningmoneyben ) goldman says likely high turnout in scotland vote means polls could be off leading to `` high risk of a surprise outcome . ''
# indyref update : can there be a surprise outcome when the polls are neck-and-neck , one reader asks ?
well , betfair has just paid out on no bets , so they 'd look pretty daft if the yes side win .
good point , though
the boss of thomas cook , harriet green , has argued that scottish independence wo n't hit demand for holidays as scots will want to visit somewhere with better weather .
the daily telegraph 's denise roland reports that green said : my personal view is we 're stronger together [ but ] scots have shown enormous resilience .
it has one of the worst climates in the world and vacation is extremely important . ''

telegraph finance ( @ telefinance ) scots will still go on holiday to escape the miserable weather , says thomas cook boss # indyref she was speaking after thomas cook reported a slowdown in demand in germany : thomas cook experiences slowdown in german holiday bookings

documents.title: boaml : scotland vote has increased investor fears over uk
text: the scottish referendum has encouraged some international investors to pull money out of the uk , according to a regular survey from bank of america merrill lynch .
here 's the section on scottish fears : , via the wsj : as opinion polls indicated the referendum for scottish independence was too close to call , negativity towards u.k. stocks deepened .
the u.k. has entrenched its status as the world 's least popular region among asset allocators this month .
a net 16 % of the panel is underweight u.k .
equities . ''
the outlook is also dim , according to boa .
the u.k. is the region that 14 % of global investors want to underweight in the coming year .
one in five investors said the region has the least favorable profit outlook , up from a net 12 % in august .

investors , often a jittery bunch , , are also worried about geopolitical tensions , the weak eurozone economy , and the consequences if the federal reserve raises interest rates next year.. of america merrill lynch more here .
katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) crowded dollar , scottish nerves .
highlights from baml 's monthly investor survey > by @ twitterid

documents.title: us producer prices unchanged in august
text: here 's something for us federal reserve policymakers to ponder as they meet today ; the prices charged at the factory gate '' by american companies were unchanged in august .
the 0.0 % change in the producer prices index , released a few minute ago , surprised economists who expected a 0.1 % rise .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) us producer prices unchanged in august ( july : +0.1 % ) .
markets were looking for a 0.1 % rise the labor department reports that falling gasoline and food costs cancelled out higher rising service sector prices , and kept the overall ppi unchanged .
on an annual basis , though , producer prices increased by 1.8 % after rising 1.7 % in july .
the fed 's two-day monetary policy meeting ends tomorrow .

documents.title: oecd proposes new rules to rein in corporate tax avoidance
text: multinational companies who play the system to slash their tax bills could face a clampdown , if new rules just announced by the oecd are imposed by g20 counties this week .

my colleague simon bowers reports : bold updates to international tax rules designed to force some of the world 's biggest multinationals - including google , apple , amazon , vodafone and glaxosmithkline - to contribute their fair share towards government budgets are to be agreed by g20 countries this weekend .

a package of draft rules and progress reports , published on tuesday by tax experts from the organisation for economic cooperation and development ( oecd ) , marks the halfway milestone in a two-year reform project which was set in train by world leaders in moscow last summer .

many of the world 's largest and best known corporations now face being forced to rapidly dismantle their elaborate cross-border corporate structures as governments move in unison in an attempt to corral them back within a joined-up and modernised network of international tax treaties .
full story : international tax rule updates to be agreed by g20 countries the guardian ( @ guardian ) international tax rule updates to be agreed by g20 countries
and here 's phillip inman on today 's record-breaking housing data : uk house prices hit new record as london average breaks £ 500,000 uk house prices by region , to july 2014
the pound has recovered some of this morning 's losses in the last few minutes , and is now trading just over $ 1.62 ( having hit $ 1.616 this morning ) .
it jumped after online bookmakers betfair announced it is paying out to anyone who wagered that the no side would win thursday 's scottish referendum .

world first ( @ world first ) gbp running higher on @ twitterid # indyref pay out steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) cable jumped 20 points on the betfair move - the mkt is wondering what they know that the rest of the mkt does not .
a reminder for eurozone crisis watchers , french pm manuel valls faces a confidence vote this afternoon .
the result could determine how much authority valls has to implement economic reforms to stimulate growth in the french economy .

from paris , kim willsher reports : the french prime minister , manuel valls , will put his political career on the line on tuesday afternoon by seeking a crucial vote of confidence from parliament in his programme to tackle the country 's economic woes .

valls , who formed a new government less than four weeks ago , needs to quell dissent that has brought bitter divisions in the ruling socialist party ( ps ) and overcome president françois hollande 's record unpopularity , to obtain a clear mandate from the lower house , the assemblee nationale .
he is expected to win the vote , but will need a very clear majority to silence the critics and give him enough support to push through proposed reforms .
a narrow victory could leave parliament paralysed just weeks before the government seeks approval of its 2015 budget bill full story here .
guardian world ( @ guardianworld ) french prime minister to seek vote of confidence from parliament

documents.title: average london house now costs £ 514,000
text: another landmark in the uk housing market the average london house price now costs more than half a million pounds .
in this morning 's survey , the office for national statistics reports that houses in the capital are now 39.7 % higher than the pre-financial crisis peak in january 2008 .
london , unsurprisingly , is the english region with the highest average house price at £ 514,000 and the north east had the lowest average house price at £ 156,000 .
london , the south east and the east all had prices higher than the uk average price of £ 272,000 , according to the ons .

uk house prices by region , to july 2014 the ft 's john aglionby says : the figure will damp claims that the market is cooling and maintain pressure on the government and the bank of england to act to contain house price inflation .

documents.title: read the full story
text: here 's my colleague katie allen on today 's inflation report : inflation drops to 1.5 % after fall in food and petrol prices a drop in food and petrol prices helped inflation edge lower last month , pushing it down to 1.5 % from 1.6 % in july , as measured by the consumer price index .
figures from the office for national statistics showed the wider retail prices index ( rpi ) measure used to set many pay deals was down to 2.4 % on the year , compared with 2.5 % in july .
both rates were as forecast by economists and they said the relatively benign price pressure in the economy would mean the bank of england is in no hurry to raise interest rates .
its monetary policy committee ( mpc ) has held borrowing costs at a record low of 0.5 % for more than five years .
inflation is still on a downward trend despite the economic recovery 's strength , '' said samuel tombs , senior uk economist at capital economics .
although the low inflation outlook is unlikely to prevent the mpc from raising interest rates entirely over the next couple of years , it should limit the speed at which they rise . ''
full story here .

calum bennie , savings expert at building society scottish friendly , warns against assuming that interest rates will remain at their record lows indefinitely : while lower inflation may reduce the likelihood of interest rates going up in short term , it is unrealistic to think that they will not rise in the midterm .
it is important that people retain a healthy dose of caution ; going on a spending blitz before the festive season is not the answer .
high street retailers might disagree
just noticed that george osborne tweeted about the dip in inflation : george osborne ( @ george osborne ) good news inflation has fallen again to just 1.5 % , below the 2 % target .
but people still feeling impact of the great recession so more to do

documents.title: tuc : still too early to raise interest rates
text: the tuc has echoed labour 's concerns over the weak uk wage growth .

general secretary frances o'grady also argues that the bank of england should hold of raising interest rates until earnings up : with inflation well under control there is no case for raising interest rates any time soon .
it would dump higher mortgage costs on households still feeling a squeeze on their living standards and risk choking off economic recovery .
as the governor of the bank of england said last week , british workers have faced pay cuts deeper than at any time since the 1920s .
the priority now has to be wage rises to ensure a sustained economic recovery and a return to growing living standards . ''
tomorrow , the boe will publish the minutes of this month 's monetary policy committee meeting , which will show how many mpc members voted to raise raises .
in august , two policymakers wanted to hike borrowing costs .

documents.title: labour : working people still feeling the squeeze despite lower inflation
text: even though the inflation rate is back at a five year low , prices in the shops are rising faster than average pay rises .

catherine mckinnell mp , labour 's shadow treasury minister , says that britons still face significant cost of living pressure : while this fall in the rate of inflation is welcome , the squeeze on working people continues .
the most recent figures show pay rising by a record low of just 0.6 per cent - less than half the rate of inflation .
wages after inflation have now fallen by over £ 1,600 a year under this government .
labour 's economic plan will tackle the cost-of-living crisis , make britain better off and earn our way to higher living standards for all , not just a few . ''
this chart from last month shows how uk pay growth have lagged inflation since around 2010 , meaning real wages have shrunk : .
arguably , workers ' willingness to accept falling real wages helped to prevent unemployment rising higher during the downturn .
alasdair cavalla , economist at the centre for economics and business research , says that this weak wage growth has also helped peg inflation .
cavalla says : two main factors have kept the uk inflation rate below the bank of england 's central target of 2.0 % over the past eight months .
weak wage growth for consumers has helped prevent prices from taking off with the recovery .
in this sense , the low inflation rate is something of a relief as it has prevented living standards from falling too far over the year so far .

geopolitics is another factor , he adds : on the global level , eurozone demand has taken a knock from the unexpected shock of the ukraine crisis , reducing pressure on global prices such as commodities and energy .
this happened against the backdrop of weakening chinese growth , an expected development but nevertheless one which has had a downward impact on key prices .
rob wood of berenberg bank also points out that core inflation ( +1.9 % ) remains higher than the main cpi index .
that showing that some of the easing in price pressures is due to volatile factors like the oil price and global food costs .
wood says : inflation is below the boe 's 2 % target mainly because of volatile food and energy prices .
core inflation actually rose to 1.9 % yoy in august , from 1.8 % in july , reflecting the rise in air fares and clothing prices .
so the underlying inflationary is not as subdued as the headlines suggest .

documents.title: bcc urges boe not to raise rates
text: the british chambers of commerce has long been arguing against an early rise in interest rates , and today 's fall in inflation has strengthened their case .
bcc chief economist david kern says : these figures highlight that inflationary pressures in the economy are easing and remain well below the 2 % target .
the drop in inflation alongside the recent stagnation in wage growth will relieve pressure on the bank of england .
while the uk recovery remains on track , this is clearly not the time to put the recovery at risk with premature interest rate rises .
the main priority for the mpc must be to nurture business confidence by offering the stability of working in a low interest rate environment .
to secure a lasting recovery the government should continue to provide further measures in key areas such as improving access to finance for growing firms , and supporting uk exporters . ''
the consumer prices index is likely to remain below the 2 % target until the middle of next year , reckons howard archer of ihs global insight .
he predicts the bank of england will raise interest rates in february 2015 , nearly six years after cutting them to the current record low of 0.5 % .

but the boe could resist hiking for even longer , he adds , despite the recent growth in employment : we suspect that low inflation , current very weak earnings growth , and the increased downside risks to economic activity coming from heightened geopolitical tensions and stuttering eurozone economic activity will cause the bank of england to hold off from acting until february at the earliest even though current ongoing robust economic activity and markedly falling unemployment provides support to the case for a near-term interest rate hike .
ben chu ( @ benchu ) cpi inflation looks more subdued now than it was even in the great recession :

documents.title: inflation : economist reaction starts here
text: i 'm going to mop up the best reaction to today 's inflation data starting with jeremy cook , chief economist at world first , who points out that underlying inflation was higher than the headline cpi reading .
of course , the headline figure does not tell the full story .
core prices surprised higher by 1.9 % in august ; they were unaffected by the slips in oil prices or the 1.1 % decline in food and booze through the past 12 months . ''
a treasury spokesperson says : the government 's long term economic plan is working , with inflation falling by more than two-thirds since its peak in september 2011 .

documents.title: danny alexander on inflation
text: danny alexander , the chief secretary to the treasury , has welcomed the drop in inflation in august and used it as a hook to urge scots to reject the chance of independence .
he says : 'today 's inflation figures are another step on the long road to our economic recovery after the great crash of 2008 .
they come just days before the most important vote on these islands in living memory .
this recovery is just one of the countless endeavours that we have shared during our hundreds of years of joint history as a united kingdom .
it 's another example that shows that by being together , our family of nations has the combined strength to overcome the challenges that life in an uncertain world inevitably throws up ' .

documents.title: german investor morale hits two-year low
text: berlin , germany .
/alamy over to germany briefly , and the ukraine crisis has hit investor confidence hard .
the monthly zew index , which tracks morale in europe 's largest economy , has slumped to just 6.9 this month , down from 8.6 in august .
that 's the lowest level since december 2012 , and the ninth fall in a row .
the gauge of current conditions plunged to 25.4 from 44.3 in august .

zew , the think tank , blamed the fall on rising uncertainty over germany 's economic prospects , given the risk of spiralling sanctions against russia , and the disappointing stare of the eurozone economy .
those house price figures are n't adjusted for inflation , by the way

documents.title: scottish house prices hit new record highs
text: scottish house prices have hit their highest level ever , rising above the pre-crisis peak of 2008 .
today 's housing data ( see 9.38am ) shows that in the year to july 2014 , average house prices increased by 12.0 % in england , 7.4 % in wales , 7.6 % in scotland and 4.5 % in northern ireland .
this has pushed house prices in scotland to new record highs , for the first time since the financial crisis , the office for national statistics reports .
it says ( on page 6 of the report ) : scotland average house prices have now passed their pre-financial crisis peak of june 2008 , and along with average prices in england are at record levels .
house prices in england , scotland , wales and northern ireland prices in wales are now 0.8 % below their pre-crisis peak .
but in northern ireland , they are still 46.7 % below their record levels ( set in 2007 ) .
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) scottish house prices rose at an annual rate of 7.6 % in july - fastest since spring 2008 # indyref
this chart shows more details of how the cost of living in the uk changed in august : .
the full inflation report is online here ( pdf ) .

here 's the details of why the uk inflation rate fell in august : falls in the price of motor fuels and food & non-alcoholic drinks produced the main downward effects on the headline rate between july and august .
petrol prices fell by 1.8 pence per litre between the two months this year , compared with a rise of 2.0 pence per litre a year ago .
similarly , diesel prices fell by 2.1 pence this year but rose by 2.0 pence a year ago .
prices of food also fell this year but rose a year ago , particularly in the milk , cheese and eggs category .
but the prices of some items up pace last month , including alcoholic drinks and women 's clothing .
offsetting these were upward effects from clothing , transport services and alcohol .
clothing prices rose , as usual , between july and august as autumn ranges started to enter the shops following the summer sales season and this year the increases were greater than a year ago .
the main effect came from price rises on women 's outerwear .
within transport services , the upward effect came from sea and air transport and within alcohol , it came from spirits and wine .

documents.title: chart : uk inflation at five-year low
text: at 1.5 % , the consumer prices index is back at its joint lowest level since 2009 : uk inflation over the last decade

documents.title: house price inflation hits seven-year high .
text: but while inflation fell , house prices have surged at their fastest rate in seven years .
average house prices in the uk jumped by 11.7 % in the year to july , according to ons data .
that 's the biggest monthly rise since 2007 .
in london , they are up by 19.1 % over the last year .
the drop in inflation in august was mainly due to falling fuel , food , non-alcoholic beverage costs , according to the office for national statistics .
the retail prices index , the inflation measure that also includes housing costs , has also fallen .
it dropped to 2.4 % in august , from 2.5 % in july .

documents.title: uk inflation rate drops to 1.5 % .
text: breaking : the uk inflation rate , as measures by the consumer prices index has fallen to 1.5 % .
that equals may 's five-year low .
details and reaction to follow

documents.title: uk inflation , a preamble .
text: ok , it 's nearly time for the main event of the morning , the uk inflation data for august .
a reminder , we 're expecting the consumer prices index to fall to 1.5 % in august , from 1.6 % last month .
that would equal may 's five-year low

documents.title: black wednesday 's 22nd anniversary
text: black wednesday - 16 september 1992 .
how the newspapers reported the sterling crisis .

/pa archive/press association ima today is also the 22nd anniversary of black wednesday , when britain was sent packing out of the european exchange rate mechanism after being outgunned by speculator george soros .
at the time , black wednesday felt like a major humiliation for the uk .
the government clung on , although john major later admitted he came close to resigning after a dramatic day in which interest rates were ( briefly ) hiked twice in a bid to support the pound .
but more than two decades later , losing the pound 's peg against rival currencies such as the deutsche mark looks like a blessing in disguise .
devaluing sterling appears to have been the trigger that ended the early-1990s recession and heralded years of growth .
joe lynam bbc biz ( @ bbc joe lynam ) 22 years ago the £ fell off the erm .
this week there could be huge sell-off of gbp if scotland votes yes

documents.title: russian ruble hits new low
text: the russian ruble has tumbled to fresh record lows today , as the selloff that began yesterday intensified .
an early burst of selling drove the ruble down 1 % , to 38.732 to the us dollar .
it has now lost 14 % of its value since july , and 18 % since the start of this year .
kit juckes of societe generale says the ruble 's weakness is highlighting the return of geopolitical risk '' .
russian ruble vs us dollar , january-september 2014 reuters and there are several reasons for the ruble 's slide .
1 ) reuters cites the hefty '' foreign debt repayments which russian companies face this month , which pushes up demand for us dollars and also leads to more foreign capital leaving russia .
2 ) a former russian finance minister , alexei kudrin , predicted this morning that the russian economy could be plunged into a deep recession of western governments implement tougher sanctions .
3 ) morgan stanley has warned that russia 's credit rating could be cut further , if the ukraine crisis continues .

alexei mikheev , an analyst at vtb 24 bank 's investment department , summed up the mood thus : you could characterise the behaviour of the market on the dollar-rouble pair as panicky and irrational . ''
kit juckes ( @ kitjuckes ) mr market is waiting for the fed , the snb , tltro and the scots .
but he 's staring at the ruble
thomas cook 's results have also failed to wow the market .
its shares are down almost 6 % , leading the ftse 250 fallers , even though earnings hit forecasts .
the holiday firm did warn that price growth remained weak , which it combated by accelerating its cost-cutting measures .
more here .
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) a weaker start for the uk pound £ as it drops below us $ 1.62 to us $ 1.617 and towards euro 1.25 # gbp
the pound is losing some ground this morning , down half a cent or 0.33 % against the us dollar at $ 1.6175 .
against the euro , it 's down 0.3 % at €1.2501 .

analysts continue to predict that sterling will tumble if the yes campaign win thursday 's scottish referendum vote.radio 4 today ( @ bbcr4today ) listen : sterling might fall `` 10 % '' if 'yes ' vote in # indyref , george godber tells @ twitterid joe lynam

documents.title: asos shares slump after cutting profit forecasts
text: disappointing profits forecasts are never in fashion in the city , as web clothing retailer asos is learning this morning .
shares in asos slumped by 15 % at the start of trading , after the company downgraded its earning expectations for the 2014-15 financial year .

the company dashed hopes of increased profits , saying it needed to make more significant investments in our international pricing and proposition , as well as in our logistical infrastructure and technology platform '' .
asos also reported that the fire at its barnsley warehouse in june cost it between £ 25m and £ 30m in lost sales .
fiona walsh ( @ fionawalsh ) asos shares slump 15 % in opening minutes after warning profits will stall in 2015 .
statement :
the press association reports that a sharper-than-expected change in inflation '' this morning could shake up the market 's expectations of when interest rates rise .

ihs global insight chief uk economist howard archer said price pressure in the uk economy is muted , with brent crude oil prices trading at two-year lows in september and the pound at a relatively strong level , despite recent volatility due to the scottish independence referendum .
mr archer added : the inflation environment currently looks benign , particularly with supermarkets heavily engaged in a food price war . ''
global insight said it expected cpi to remain at around the current levels and clearly under 2 % over the rest of 2014 and through the early months of 2015 .
but capital economics , which predicts cpi to drop to around 1.4 % today , said the inflation measure could hit 1 % by the end of 2014 .

it said : we continue to think that a combination of stable energy bills , lower import prices and weak growth in unit wages will enable cpi inflation to fall to as low as 1 % by the end of this year and remain weak in 2015 . ''
the retail prices index , the broader measure of inflation , is expected to also drop from july 's 2.5 % to 2.4 % , according to a reuters poll .
even if uk inflation does fall to 1.5 % , it will mean prices are rising ahead of wage growth .
the latest labour market figures , released last month , showed that average earnings ( ex-bonuses ) grew by just 0.6 % annually in the three months to june .
we get fresh data tomorrow .
britain 's inflation rate has been below 2 % since january , having soared way over the bank of england 's target in 2010 and 2011 , as this chart shows : uk inflation , 2007-2014 reuters

documents.title: markets poised for uk inflation
text: the bank of england in london .
devlin/pa good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the economy , the financial markets , business and the eurozone .
the pressure on the bank of england to raise interest rates could ease today , with the release of the latest uk inflation rate , for august , at 9.30am bst .
economists predict that the consumer prices index fell last month , from 1.6 % to 1.5 % , further from the boe 's 2 % target , partly thanks to lower energy costs .

as jasper lawler of cmc markets explains , that would reduce the chances of a hike in borrowing costs : all things equal , a drop in inflation today especially alongside a fall in wages tomorrow would ease pressure on the bank of england over hiking rates and add more pressure onto an oversold british pound .

it will be matter of judging the need for a rate hike as suggested by data against the committee 's hawkishness in tomorrow 's minutes [ of this month 's meeting ] for the chance of a change in expected timeline for the first rate hike .

mind you , if scotland votes for independence on thursday , the resulting turmoil would probably make an early interest rate rise rather unlikely we 'll also get the latest german investor confidence data at 10am bst ; the zew index is expected to fall , as the escalating conflict in east ukraine spooks europe 's largest economy , with its close links to russia .
over in france , the embattled government faces a confidence vote .

prime minister manuel valls should survive it , despite francois hollande 's slumping popularity and concerns over the weak french economy frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) today 's french confidence vote unlikely to fail but no formality either given the government 's slim majority and strong abstention .
we 're not expecting any fireworks in the european markets this morning , after a mixed but unexciting session in asia as investors await wednesday 's federal reserve meeting .
peter hoskins ( @ peterhoskinssky ) a pretty flat open seen for share markets with @ twitterid and # indyref still in focus .

financial bookies : ftse100 +7 , dax +7 , cac40 +4 michael kitchen ( @ kitchennews ) asia at afternoon kospi up 0.4 % shanghai up 0.3 % nikkei , hk , sensex all down 0.1 % each asx down 0.5 % taiex down 0.8 % $ nik $ hsi $ xjo and there are corporate results from thomas cook and from asos , the web fashion retailer recently hit by a warehouse fire , to digest
